I've been gaming as a hobby on Linux for a long time and find the current gaming scene to be very good. The incredible efforts of the community and Valve with wine/proton and dxvk have made Linux a viable alternative now. There are more than 6000 Linux-compatible games on Steam, along with thousands more which can be played via Proton.
The only real problems are EAC through wine and some DRM (just search for a crack!).
